channel.title: Cancer - Other on VitaminDWiki
channel.description: Recent content in Cancer - Other on VitaminDWiki

item.title: Following Digestive Cancer 2,000 IU of Vitamin D were given. Those whose Omega-3 levels rose had fewer Cancer problems – RCT
item.description:
• Interaction of Vitamin D Supplements and Marine n-3 Fatty Acids on Digestive Tract Cancer Prognosis
      • 5 related items in VitaminDWiki

Interaction of Vitamin D Supplements and Marine n-3 Fatty Acids on Digestive Tract Cancer Prognosis

Cancer Prognosis. Nutrients 2024,16,921. https://doi.org/10.3390/nul6070921

Soichiro Fukuzato ©, Hironori Ohdaira 2, Yutaka Suzuki 2 and Mitsuyoshi Urashima 1,

Division of Molecular Epidemiology, Jikei University School of Medicine, Tokyo 105-8461, Japan; sunshine1.324@jikei.ac.jp

Department of Surgery, International University of Health and Welfare Hospital, Narita-shi 286-0048, Japan; ohdaira@iuhw.ac.jp (H.O.); yutaka@iuhw.ac.jp (Y.S.)

item.title: Benign Cancers of a portion of the brain increased 1.8 X after vaccines were available
item.description:
Why are Intracranial Tumors & Breast Cancers Surging Among Younger People Since 2021 in the UK?

Trial Site News

Benign neoplasm Brain infratentorial = tumors located in the cerebellum or brainstem

2 year rate: 196 ==> 349

See also VitaminDWiki   Note: COVID decreases Vitamin D getting to cells for a long time

  • Multiple COVID vaccinations might increase Cancer Incidence - many studies

item.title: Gynecological cancers and atherosclerosis (perhaps a Vitamin D association)
item.description:
• Correlation between gynecological tumors and atherosclerotic diseases
      • Recommendation: Take Vitamin D to reduce the risk of cancers, atherosclerosis, and many other health problems

Correlation between gynecological tumors and atherosclerotic diseases

Arch Med Sci Atheroscler Dis. 2023 Dec 30:8:e118-e122. doi: 10.5114/amsad/176655

Francesk Mulita 1, Vasileios Leivaditis 2, Platon Dimopoulos 3, Artemis Ibra 1, Fotios Iliopoulos 4, Konstantinos Tasios 1, Christos Pitros 5, Charalampos Kaplanis 1, Angelis Peteinaris 6, Konstantinos Bouchagier 1, Spyros Papadoulas 5, Michail Pitiakoudis 7
